Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Athena wearing a Corinthian helmet. Mould-made and hollow with a crudely made back. Traces of orange paint or slip. Fine red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions. Head only, back is missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Well B (= Hogarth site 35)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'B' written on the back, possibly relates to its find spot in Well B (Gutch 1899, 91-92, pl.13, no.176).
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 91, no. 176, pl. XIII, no. 176)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.227) (Phase 3)
